        [ch]Bm7[/ch]                           [ch]E7[/ch]                   [ch]A[/ch]

        [ch]Bm7[/ch]                         [ch]E7[/ch]                         [ch]A[/ch]

[Chorus]

[ch]D[/ch]              [ch]E7[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]               [ch]F#m[/ch]

[ch]D[/ch]                     [ch]E7[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]

                          [ch]E7[/ch]           [ch]Bm7[/ch]     [ch]E[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch]
if I stay here, won't you listen to my heart,   whoa,    heart?

[Verse]

blue for the tears,  black for the night fears,  the stars in the sky
           [ch]E7[/ch]                        [ch]A[/ch]
don't mean nothing to you, they're a mirror

plays. He plays strings 6 and 5 with his index finger(bar-chordish), and uses his
ring finger(after your middle finger) to play strings 4-2. So keep that in mind
and start playing! Kurt lives in us all.

Tabbed by: Rogelio
Tuning: Standard

Here's my take on it. It's not 100% correct, but it's the best I could do.

Chords  [ [ch]E[/ch] [ch]A[/ch] [ch]D[/ch] [ch]G[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]E[/ch] ]:
Fmaj7   [ 1 3 3 2 1 0 ]
F       [ 1 3 3 2 1 1 ]
Am7     [ x 0 2 0 1 x ]
Em7     [ 0 2 2 0 3 x ]
Em      [ 0 2 2 0 0 x ]
C       [ x 3 2 0 1 x ]
G       [ x 2 0 0 3 x ]
G*      [ 3 2 0 0 3 3 ] (just a secondary way of playing G, more like the main way
actually. Use this when there's an asterisk next to the G)


The Fmaj7 is a pretty crucial chord, it gives the song the whole feel. It's weird, since
you can't exactly substitute it with a regular F chord, except at the last lines of the
verses where Frank sings "Do you think about me still?" and anywhere else where the F 
isn't a major 7th. Be sure you hit that open E. As for the rest of the chords (with the
exception of the F and alt G), try not to hit the high E string.
